chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Then, at the arrival of the holy Gospel, with a clear melody, the clergy once again sings AIUS in the form of angels before the face of Christ, crying out at the gates of hell:

"Lift up your heads, O gates, and be lifted up, O ancient doors, and the King of glory shall come in." Psalm 24:7
chunks.original_latin:
Tunc in adventu sancti Evangelii claro modulamine
denuo psallet clerus Aius in specie angelorum ante
faciem Christi ad portas inferi clamantium: Tollite
portas principes vestras, et elevamini portae aeternales,
et introibit Dominus virtutum rex gloriae (Ps XXIII 7).
